programmes.show_description: Two chilling crimes on one night of terror as a late-night supermarket argument explodes into shocking violence and three masked men break into a 70-year-old's bedroom. (Ep3)
A car sale on social media turns into a knife-point carjacking and a high-speed car chase. In Sheffield, the hit-and-run death of an elderly man takes a disturbing twist. (Ep4)

programmes.show_name: Super Surgeons: A Chance at Life
programmes.show_description: The series that goes behind the scenes at world-leading cancer hospital the Royal Marsden. Aspiring midwife Anthea has a difficult tumour that could lead to arm amputation.
In Nottingham, staff at Queen's Medical Centre deal with a crime wave of needle-spiking attacks on female university students, including Kate, who collapsed at a nightclub.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Jeep Grand Cherokee: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head for Somerset to turn former soldier Ben's run-down classic Jeep into an off-roading machine.
Virginia Is for Pickers: It's a picking blitz in Virginia, as Mike, Frank, Robbie and Danielle all hit the road to leave no lead unturned in a bid to double their income.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk to meet Margaret, an avid collector and former mayor - so they need to be on their best behaviour!
In grand finale week, the winners from all heats transform outbuildings into their proposed businesses. As practicalities collide with imagination, who can keep their dream alive? (Ep16/20)
Brian and Rita both have busy lives and can't wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca for relaxing getaways with their family. Jasmine Harman shows them what their £150k can buy.
Sara Damergi helps Bernie and Vernon find a holiday home on Fuerteventura, even though Vernon's never been there! Can they find the perfect place for their £150k?
Belfast. First to host is make-up artist and impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill - aka Lady Portia Diamante - who steals the limelight with a red carpet-themed evening. (Ep1/5)
Belfast. Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up authentic Caribbean cuisine in a bid to impress his guests - particularly glamorous navy officer Fiona. (Ep2/5)
Belfast. Feminist writer Cat Anderson hopes to raise the bar with a home-cooked feast and attentive service. But will her bohemian chic style and live music wow her guests? (Ep3/5)
Belfast. Charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth hopes to win over her guests with her 'come as your teenage self' dress code and a zingy mojito cheesecake. (Ep4/5)
Belfast. It's the final day and merchant navy officer Fiona Rush dishes up a nautical-themed evening, featuring maritime entertainment and a very fishy menu. (Ep5/5)
Maria and Paul dream of owning a home away from home among the Andalusian countryside, to escape the English winters. Can Craig Rowe find 'the one' for their budget of £270k?
Kirstie and Phil revisit globetrotter Matt in Windsor, and Justin and Deborah in Sheffield, to see what a few new additions to the family did for their house-hunting dreams.
...Crisp Factory: It's crunch time, as one of Britain's best-known brands launches its latest crisp flavour. From soil to shelf, we tear into the journey of how Walkers' new crisp is born.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: It's a Cullercoats catch-up, as we see how Mark and Suze are getting on after transforming their topsy-turvy townhouse. Do they still have the renovation bug?
In Nottingham, staff at Queen's Medical Centre deal with a crime wave of needle-spiking attacks on female university students, including Kate, who collapsed at a nightclub.
The story of one of Britain's most successful and controversial prime ministers, following Blair's meteoric rise to Labour leader and prime minister with a landslide in 1997. (Ep1/3)
From the peak of his powers to his most controversial decision - how Blair took Britain to war in Iraq. With contributions from Blair, Bill Clinton and leading opponents of the war. (Ep2)
Weakened by the Iraq war, Blair's forced out of office by his own party. Blair seeks to build a new legacy on a global scale but is repeatedly forced to defend his time in Number 10. (Ep3)
On the beat dealing with Brighton's hectic nightlife as trouble comes thick and fast for the night coppers - from a bunch of youths in a street fight to a knocked-out football fan.
Gordon Returns 1: Gordon revisits three restaurants - Handlebar, Casa Roma and The Black Pearl - to check in with the owners he helped. Has his advice been put to good use?
Gordon Returns 2: Gordon Ramsay revisits two restaurants - Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Rover SD1: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel back in time with a 1986 Rover SD1, which belongs to 58-year-old landscape gardener Darren, whose ill health has taken its toll.
The More You No: Mike, Frank, Danielle and Robbie continue to double down in Virginia but hit a roadblock with a seller who won't let go of a one-of-a-kind find.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet farmer Ken. In his barns, Henry finds a rare pre-WWII exercise bike and farmyard potato scales.
Nick and Nicole from Chateau DIY join Max to judge the business-plan builds. But with only two places available to progress, the pressure becomes too much for some... (Ep17/20)
Angela and Simon dream of owning a farmhouse in France's Poitou-Charentes region, where they can indulge in art and yoga. Lucy Alexander shows them what £225k can buy.
Marcia wants a holiday home in the Gran Alacant area of Spain's Costa Blanca for her £110k. Will a spacious apartment hitting all the right notes or a tempting townhouse be the perfect one?
York. First to host is motivational master and training guru Steve Carlyle, whose 'sophisticated' dinner party does anything but boost his reputation. (Ep1/5)
York. Eccentric ghost-tour guide Trevor Rooney throws a fright night-themed evening in a haunted bric-a-brac warehouse, accompanied by his ventriloquist doll, Woody. (Ep2/5)
York. Hippy host Annie Albericci hopes to bring peace and love on her festival chic-themed night, with entertainment from Hendrix the dog. But Steve threatens to ruin the mood. (Ep3/5)
York. Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts a 1960s-themed dinner party. But she worries that straight-talking Steve will ruin the evening for everyone. (Ep4/5)
York. It's a night of flirting and friction on the final day of the competition, as foodie perfectionist Rebecca Ryan throws a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour. (Ep5/5)
Candy and Mark are looking for the perfect rural retreat to escape to in Almería in southern Spain. Ben Hillman lines up five fab options for £75k, but will any of them result in an offer?
Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of family home-hunters: Ian in the seaside town of Broadstairs, Kent, and newly-engaged couple Tara and Alastair in Edinburgh.
...Alice Roberts: In Rome, Alice digs into some of the stories behind the city's world-famous ancient landmarks and Rome's debt to the Etruscans. In Florence, it's time for cocktails. (Ep3)
...with The Rev Richard Coles: Richard enjoys a Wight good time at Cowes Week racing regatta and tests out his seven-star service skills at a superyacht school. (Ep3/4)
On the beat dealing with Brighton's hectic nightlife as trouble comes thick and fast for the night coppers - from a bunch of youths in a street fight to a knocked-out football fan.
The cops are called to an incident at a petrol station. There's a complicated domestic dispute about missing teeth. A disgruntled drunk targets a security guard's nether regions.

programmes.show_name: Joe Lycett: I'm About to Lose...
programmes.show_description: ...Control and I Think Joe Lycett: Joe shares jokes, paintings and some trolling he's been up to, such as breaking into banks, selling art for £12.5million and taking on Olympic medallists.
